subject: RE: [junit] Proposed parameterized test syntax for JUnit 4
msgSnippet: Cedric, If I need different sets of parameters for different tests, I put the tests in different classes. This way, tests don t see parameters they don t need.

Cedric,

If I need different sets of parameters for different tests, I put =
the tests
in different classes. This way, tests don't see parameters they d=
on't need.
The same goes for fields set in a set-up method. Only tests that=
 need
exactly the same setup go in the same class.

Kent Beck
Three Rivers =
Institute
